title: Propionic acid
description: Propionic acid -from the Greek words protos, meaning "first", and pion, meaning "fat"; also known as propanoic acid- is a naturally occurring carboxylic acid with chemical formula CH3CH2CO2H.  It is a liquid with a pungent and unpleasant smell somewhat resembling body odor. The anion CH3CH2CO2âˆ’ as well as the salts and esters of propionic acid are known as propionates -or propanoates-.
